Detailed Description

This file contains implementation of MIN logger API.

Version:
0.1

Function Documentation

LOCAL MinDataLogger * mdl_create ( const TSChar *  path,
const TSChar *  file,
TSLoggerType  loggertype,
unsigned int  output,
TSBool  overwrite,
TSBool  withtimestamp,
TSBool  withlinebreak,
TSBool  witheventranking,
TSBool  pididtologfile,
TSBool  createlogdir,
unsigned int  staticbuffersize,
TSBool  unicode 
)

Creates a new MIN data logger instance.

Parameters:
path [in] output directory.
file [in] output file.
loggertype [in] type of the logger that is in use.
output [in] output plugin.
overwrite [in] overwrite file if exists flag.
withtimestamp [in] add timestamp flag.
withlinebreak [in] add linebreak flag.
witheventranking [in] do event ranking flag.
pididtologfile [in] process id to logfile flag.
createlogdir [in] create output directory if not exists flag.
staticbuffersize [in] size of the static buffer.
unicode [in] unicode flag.
Returns:
pointer to logger instance.

LOCAL void mdl_destroy ( MinDataLogger **  sdl  ) 

Destroys MIN data logger instance.

Parameters:
shl address of pointer to data logger instance.

LOCAL int mdl_send ( struct logger_typeinfo_t *  lt,
int  style,
const TSChar *  msg 
)

Send log message through data logger output plugin(s).

Parameters:
lt holds logger type and plugins
style logging style option
msg log message
Returns:
ENOERR on success, -1 on error.

Creates MIN Logger 'object'

Parameters:
path [in] output directory.
file [in] output file.
loggertype [in] type of the logger that is in use.
overwrite [in] overwrite file if exists flag.
withtimestamp [in] add timestamp flag.
withlinebreak [in] add linebreak flag.
witheventranking [in] do event ranking flag.
pididtologfile [in] process id to logfile flag.
createlogdir [in] create output directory if not exists flag.
staticbuffersize [in] size of the static buffer.
unicode [in] unicode flag.
Returns:
new instance of MinLogger or INITPTR in case of failure.

Destroys MIN Logger instance.

NOTE: after being freed the pointer is set to INITPTR;

unicode [in] unicode flag.

Writes delimiter to the log.
